author: Special Correspondent
text:
The National Council for Promotion of Urdu Language (NCPUL), under the Ministry of Human Resource Development, offers a one-year Urdu diploma course for starters. The course offered through correspondence mode will be conducted by the Gausiya Foundation here.

There is no restriction on age limit or minimum educational qualification for joining the course. Contact classes will be conducted during weekends and the study materials provided free of cost. The Ministry of Human Resource Development will issue the certificate on successful completion of the course. The fee is Rs. 200 and the last date for submission of applications is February 20.

Interested candidates can contact phone number 0452 4376678, a press release from A. G. Mohamed Ashraf Gani Sayani, president, Gausiya Foundation, issued here on Sunday said.
title: Diploma course in Urdu
